characters.name: Trucy Wright
characters.description1: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.

characters.name: Athena Cykes
characters.description1: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.

characters.name: Phoenix Wright
characters.description1: My boss. He's taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.

characters.name: Bonny → Bonny de Famme
characters.description1: A bunny-themed assistant who appeared onstage with Trucy.
characters.description2: A magician who performed teleportation magic during the show.

characters.name: Mr. Retinz → Roger Retinz
characters.description1: A man somehow connected to the magic show. He showed up at the theater after the incident took place.
characters.description2: A producer at Take-2 TV known as the Ratings Rajah. He's famous, apparently.

characters.name: The Great Mr. Reus
characters.description1: The victim in this case. A magician who took the stage with Trucy.
characters.description2: The victim in this case. His real name is Manov Mistree.

characters.name: Ema Skye
characters.description1: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensic investigator she always wanted to be.

characters.name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
characters.description1: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."

characters.name: Betty de Famme
characters.description1: A magician who performed with Trucy. She is actually Bonny's twin sister.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.

evidences.name: Stage Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.

evidences.name: Crime Photo
evidences.description1: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.

evidences.name: Fingerprinting Results
evidences.description1: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top.

evidences.name: Fire Bucket
evidences.description1: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.

evidences.name: Gramarye Notebook
evidences.description1: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.

evidences.name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
evidences.description1: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.

evidences.name: Show Script
evidences.description1: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident.

evidences.name: Contract
evidences.description1: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.

evidences.name: Trucy's Statement
evidences.description1: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.

evidences.name: Sword Stand
evidences.description1: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.

evidences.name: Stage Lift #2
evidences.description1: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.

evidences.name: Show Footage
evidences.description1: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.

evidences.name: Clipboard
evidences.description1: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.

evidences.name: Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.

evidences.name: Prank Plan Script
evidences.description1: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.

evidences.name: Trucy's Note
evidences.description1: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature.
